emuInput.TitMainTitle: Group portrait the Deuces Wild band, from left: Flo Cassinelli on tenor sax, Don Mastri on bass, Bob Negri on piano, and Spider Rondinelli on drums, performing at Crawford Grill No. 2
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 14, 1955, pg. 20, reads: "Grill Two Headliners - The crowd-pleasing Deuces Wild, currently filling Crawford Grill Two, at Elmore and Wylie, with sweet music, will be at the popular spot for the next two weeks. They have played successful engagements at many of the city's top clubs.  Presently they have two crazy records going : "Ultra" and "that's All That Matters to Me."  To be released in near future are "Swat Mist" and "I Want a Little Girl," all on the Moss label.  That's Flo Cassinelli on the tenor sax; Don Mastri, bass; Bob Negri, piano, and Spider Rondinelli, drums. - Harris PHoto."
